# Number of lines of code in mod: 5
sub mod {   # for some reason perl's % doesn't seem to work for large numbers?
    my $a = shift;
    my $b = shift;
    $a - int($a/$b)*$b;
}
public method PGrandom::new (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:
click to view
# Number of lines of code in new: 16
sub new {
    my $class           = shift;
    my $seed            = shift;

    $seed    = 1 unless defined($seed);
    my $original_seed = $seed;
    $seed    =  mod ($multiplier * $seed + $translate, $modulus);
    my $self = { 'seed'             => $seed,
                 'original_seed'    => $original_seed,  # this and the next value are largely for debugging
                 'number_of_calls'  => 1                # there is always one call to set the seed.
    };

    bless $self, $class;

    return $self;
}

# Number of lines of code in rand: 6
sub rand {
    my $self  = shift;
    my $end   = shift;
    $end = 1 unless defined($end);
    $self->random(0,$end,0);
}
public method PGrandom::random (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:
click to view
# Number of lines of code in random: 19
sub random {
    my $self  = shift;
    my $begin = shift;
    my $end   = shift;
    my $incr  = shift;
    my $out;
    $self->{'number_of_calls'}++;
    $incr     = 1 unless defined($incr);
    my $seed = $self->{'seed'};
    my $new_seed = mod ($multiplier * $seed + $translate, $modulus) ;
    $self->{'seed'} = $new_seed;
    unless ( $incr <= 0 ) {
        $out = $begin +$incr*int( ($new_seed/($modulus))*(int( ($end-$begin)/$incr) +1) );
    } else {                    # if $incr is less than zero return "continuous" distribution
        $out = $begin + ($end-$begin)*$new_seed/$modulus;
    }
    $out;

}
public method PGrandom::seed (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:

# Number of lines of code in seed: 4
sub seed {  #synonym for srand
    my $self = shift;
    $self->srand(@_);
}
public method PGrandom::srand (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:
click to view
# Number of lines of code in srand: 8
sub srand {
    my $self = shift;
    my $new_seed = shift;
    $self->{'original_seed'} = $new_seed;
    $new_seed= mod ($multiplier * $new_seed + $translate, $modulus) ;   # reset the seed
    $self->{'number_of_calls'}=1;
    $self->{'seed'} = $new_seed;
}
